intro: Amethystanthus inflexus var. macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leaf amethyst flower, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its elongated, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple, often with contrasting white or cream markings. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This species is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to add a dramatic touch to gardens.
